image_1.description: DS true positive data refers to correctly labeled positive instances in the dataset, which the DSGAN framework aims to identify and preserve.
DS false positive data refers to instances in the dataset that are incorrectly labeled as positive, a key issue addressed by the DSGAN framework.

image_2.description: The DS positive dataset is a collection of samples used for training the generator and discriminator within the DSGAN system, containing positive examples for training the models and aiming to collapse the discriminator through overfitting.

The Generator is a component of the DSGAN system, responsible for producing a set of probability distribution over a bag of DS positive samples and sampling sentences based on that distribution, aiming to fool the discriminator into classifying these samples as real.

The Discriminator is a component of the DSGAN system, tasked with distinguishing between high-confidence and low-confidence samples generated by the Generator, and providing feedback to the generator to improve its performance.

image_4.description: DSGAN refers to a robust adversarial learning strategy used for distant supervision relation extraction, represented by red squares in the graphs.

image_5.description: /business/person/company is one of the relation types used as an example in the training process of DSGAN, representing the accuracy trend for business/person/company category.
/people/person/place lived is another relation type from the people class of Reidel dataset used in the training process, representing the accuracy trend for people/person/place_lived category.

/location/neighborhood/neighborhood of is a relation type from the location class used to illustrate the training process, representing the accuracy trend for location/neighborhood/neighborhood_of category.

image_8.description: DSGAN is a generative adversarial network designed to improve the performance of relation extraction models, used for detecting true positive samples from a noisy distant supervision dataset, and is a robust adversarial learning strategy for distant supervision relation extraction.

CNN+ONE is a model that combines Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) with a one-hot encoding scheme, and is one of the recent state-of-the-art models used in the comparison to observe the improvement brought by the redistributed dataset.

CNN+ATT is a model that combines Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) with an attention mechanism, and is another state-of-the-art model used in the comparison to evaluate the performance improvement after applying the redistributed dataset.

PCNN+ONE is a model that combines Position-aware Convolutional Neural Network (PCNN) with a one-hot encoding scheme, and is one of the models used in the comparison to assess the effectiveness of the redistributed dataset on improving distant supervision relation extraction.

PCNN+ATT is a model that combines Position-aware Convolutional Neural Network (PCNN) with an attention mechanism, and is included in the comparison to determine the impact of the redistributed dataset on the performance of distant supervision relation extraction.
